task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 191°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To see the full height of the main building in front (south direction), I need to look up to view its roof, so I'll rotate the camera upward by 30 degrees.
I'm currently facing North (0°) but the target building is to the South (191°), so I need to rotate my heading to 191° to face the target building again.
I am facing the target building but can only see its lower portion; I need to look up by rotating the camera upward 30 degrees to view the roof and assess the full height.
My heading has shifted to North (0°) again, so I need to rotate to 191° heading (South) while maintaining a 30° upward pitch to view the full height of the target building.

To confirm the ground level of the target building and ensure I can reference the full height from ground to roof, I will rotate the camera downward by 30 degrees while maintaining the 191° south heading.
I'm facing North (0°) which is opposite the target building's South direction, so I need to rotate my heading to 191° and set pitch to 0° to face the building with a level view.
I can now see the target building clearly; it appears to be an 8-story structure with each floor roughly 3 meters high, so the total estimated height is 24 meters.
